definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
to come to mind/to come to one's attention

sentences.english: Just a few things off the top of my head regarding upgradable bags.
sentences.chinese: 一些关于背包升级的想法一直在我脑海里盘旋。

sentences.english: The image of the woman popped into his head out of the blue.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人的形象突然出现在他的脑海里。

sentences.english: Unforgettable scenes flashed across his mind.
sentences.chinese: 一幕难忘的情景，立即在他脑海映现。

sentences.english: Then go back to your problem and write down any ideas that come to mind.
sentences.chinese: 之后再回到你的问题，并写下脑海里冒出的想法。

sentences.english: A riot of questions filled my mind.
sentences.chinese: 一个问题萦回在我的脑海中。

sentences.english: The auguries of death are fast gathering round his head.
sentences.chinese: 死亡凶兆迅速地在他脑海中盘旋。

sentences.english: Glows and grows in the murk of his brain.
sentences.chinese: 在他阴暗沉郁的脑海里闪耀亮光。

sentences.english: It could be just a memory that floats into your head for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 它可以只是一些无缘由的飘过脑海中的记忆罢了。

sentences.english: Out of my heart , in to your head.
sentences.chinese: 在我的心之外，浮想在你的脑海。

sentences.english: A mental picture is worth a thousand words.
sentences.chinese: 一张脑海中的心理图片强得过千言万语。

sentences.english: The scene photographed itself on my mind.
sentences.chinese: 这个景象深深地印在我的脑海中。

sentences.english: Although it was over many years, but I still could remember concretely in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 虽然事隔多年但那个场景仍然深深印在脑海中。

sentences.english: I leave that moment, that twilight of the background on my mind occupied.
sentences.chinese: 我在离去那刻，那风烛残年的背景就在我脑海占据了。

sentences.english: I also sometimes get all kinds of images streaming through my mind during self hypnosis.
sentences.chinese: 自我催眠过程中有时候会有各种图像从脑海中流过。

sentences.english: Speaking of Chen Juan, in your mind what kind of response is singing?
sentences.chinese: 说起陈涓，在你的脑海中回响的是怎样的歌声？

sentences.english: Once an idea has taken hold of the brain it's almost impossible to eradicate.
sentences.chinese: 一旦一种想法盘亘脑海，便难以消除。

definition: to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
to flash through (one's mind)/to dodge (away from pursuers)
mind/state of mind/attention/(Chinese medicine) psychic constitution
in the depth of one's soul
divine light (around the Buddha)/a halo/a miraculous column of light/(slang) jolly good!
